title: Amoeba found in well water at house of girl who died due to amoebic encephalitis in Kerala
content: Following detection of amoeba, fever survey has been carried out among all those who used the water from the well

title: Karnataka rains: Eight bridges submerged as water levels rise in Krishna and Malaprabha rivers, warning issued
content: Maharashtra irrigation officials informed their counterparts in Karnataka that outflow from the Koyna dam on the Krishna river was being increased

title: Biodiversity of Thattekad Bird Sanctuary in Kerala grows richer as survey reveals nine new species
content: Findings of three-day faunal survey, which adopted a multi-taxa approach, at Kerala’s first bird sanctuary reaffirms its position as one of the richest ecological zones in Western Ghats

title: Kishtwar cloudburst: Death toll climbs to 64 after woman’s body recovered
content: The decomposed body was sighted downstream and subsequently recovered by the rescuers amid intensified search operation with the improvement in the weather, the officials said

title: In a first, American Hindu Coalition endorses Pakistani American candidate in Virginia race
content: The election is scheduled for November 4, and while Mr. Khan acknowledges the uphill battle of contesting in a largely blue district, he believes that support from Indian and Hindu American voters could provide a decisive edge.

title: Soldier assaulted at U.P. toll plaza, Army condemns; six held, NHAI slaps ₹20 lakh fine on operator
content: When Kapil’s car was caught in a long queue en route to the Delhi airport, he asked the toll staff to clear the way faster, leading to an altercation

title: Lot of interest about Gaganyaan world over: Shubhanshu Shukla tells PM Modi
content: PM Modi said there was a need to have a pool of 40-50 astronauts ready for India’s future space missions

title: Parliament Monsoon session Day 19 LIVE: Rajya Sabha adjourns till 2 p.m. amid Opposition protests; loud protests rock Lok Sabha
content: Opposition MPs have submitted notices in both Houses to discuss Bihar SIR; Rajya Sabha passed the Indian Ports Bill, 2025 on Monday (August 18, 2025)

title: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar embarks on 3-day visit to Russia
content: S Jaishankar will co-chair the 26th Session of the India-Russia Inter-Governmental Commission on Trade, Economic, Scientific, Technological and Cultural Cooperation to be held on Wednesday, August 20

title: Tamil Nadu, Kerala ask Supreme Court if Presidential Reference is a ploy to contradict itself
content: Kerala and Tamil Nadu have criticised the Presidential Reference for “suppressing” the very existence of the Tamil Nadu Governor case judgment of April 8

title: Supreme Court hearing on Presidential Reference LIVE: We will only be expressing our view on the law and not pronounce a judgment in the TN case: CJI
content: A Constitution Bench headed by Chief Justice of India B.R. Gavai is hearing on the Reference with Kerala and Tamil Nadu getting an hour to convince the Court to return the Reference unanswered

title: Ganga level in Haridwar crosses warning level, rescue personnel on alert
content: The water level, already 10 cm above the warning level on August 18, 2025, was rising, prompting the administration to ask people near the floodplains to remain alert

title: Yamuna water level rises close to evacuation mark in Delhi
content: Officials said the situation is being closely monitored and all the agencies concerned have been asked to take precautionary measures to handle flood-like situation

title: Two youths electrocuted while transporting Ganesh idol in Hyderabad
content: The incident reportedly happened when the idol brushed against overhead power lines, sending a surge of current through the group

title: Who decides nominations to UT Assemblies? | Explained
content: How should members be recommended to the Jammu & Kashmir Legislative Assembly? What does the Government of Union Territories Act, 1963 state with respect to nominations to the Puducherry Assembly? What was the ‘triple chain of command’ opined by the Supreme Court in 2023?

title: Mumbai rains LIVE: Red alert issued for Mumbai; schools and colleges to remain shut on August 19 in Thane and Palghar
content: All government offices in Mumbai to be closed today; BMC requested private offices to immediately instruct their employees to work from home

title: Parai resounds across city’s neighbourhoods
content: As more people step up to learn this art form, finding a place to practise isn’t easy; the parai collectives tell members to focus on career and education, and pursue parai as an art form

title: Tea sector in the Peerumade hills grappling with fresh challenges
content: The active number of tea estates in the Peerumade hills was 40, and the number has now dropped to 28, data shows

title: Young anacondas use surprising S-shaped gait to make quick escapes
content: Researchers from IIT-Bombay and Harvard University have said that by providing precise mathematical measures to reproduce such motion in artificial systems, their study can help accelerate innovation in soft robotics. One example: snake-like robots that can navigate through very narrow or confined spaces

title: Headmaster accused of assaulting student in Kasaragod; Minister orders inquiry
content: Headmaster denies allegation, saying that he had only reprimanded the boy for misbehaving during the assembly. Youth Congress demands suspension of HM

title: Govt. finding it tough to fill V-C posts
content: State-run universities are finding it difficult to fill up the Vice-Chancellor’s post owing to applications from ineligible persons, Higher Education Minister M.C. Sudhakar

title: Internal quota: Options being worked out to bring about consensus
content: Monday evening saw hectic parleys among Ministers and officials belonging to Scheduled Castes to arrive at a consensus on the internal reservation on the eve of the special Cabinet meeting, even as the Dalit left (Madigas) and the Dalit right (Holeyas) continued to exert pressure on the government

title: Same-sex couples demand recognition as ‘spouses’ in the IT Act to receive tax benefits
content: The petitioners argued that they should not be denied benefits under the law solely because their partnership is not heterosexual

title: Karnataka Assembly plunges into pandemonium over Dharmasthala row
content: The Legislative Assembly plunged into pandemonium on Monday over the case of alleged mass burials in Dharmasthala, with the ruling and the Opposition members indulging in heated exchange of words

title: Activists, Opposition parties seek probe into West Bengal’s Deocha-Pachami coal project
content: They alleged financial irregularities, violation of tender agreement, and massive damage to the environment and local communities in connection with the project in Birbhum district

title: Back-to-back arrest of MSC vessels poses challenge to Vizhinjam port
content: The arrest of MSC vessels specifically at the Vizhinjam port sends a wrong signal to the world regarding the port, say port sources. This comes at a time when the port is already witnessing a decline in container discharge.

title: CPI urges government to form expert committee to release Tamil Nadu Labour Policy
content: The party’s 26th State Conference concludes. One of the key resolutions passed during the conference criticises the Centre for consolidating 44 labour welfare laws into four labour codes, against which workers across the country have been protesting

title: CPI(M) criticises Thirumavalavan for comments on conservancy workers
content: CPI(M) State secretary P. Shanmugam challenges Mr. Thirumavalavan’s position and urged him to clarify his stance

title: Putin, security guarantees and a hot mic: Zelenskyy's suit diplomacy woos Trump
content: President Trump's recent meeting with Ukrainian President Zelenskyy and European leaders signals a potential path to peace talks with Russia, a stark contrast to their previous strained encounter. Discussions revolved around European-led security guarantees for Ukraine, with Trump hinting at US support. Arrangements are underway for a Zelenskyy-Putin meeting, though disagreements persist over ceasefire terms and territorial compromises.

title: China assures India on key needs- Rare earths, fertilisers & tunnel boring machines
content: China has pledged to address India's concerns regarding rare earths, fertilizers, and tunnel boring machines, as assured by Foreign Minister Wang Yi to Dr. Jaishankar. Discussions encompassed trade, pilgrimages, and border issues, emphasizing mutual respect and avoiding escalation of differences into disputes.

title: 'But you’re always on your phone': Anupam Mittal recalls daughter's lesson
content: Anupam Mittal, Shaadi.com founder, shared a parenting lesson learned from his daughter about leading by example. His daughter's remark about his phone usage highlighted the hypocrisy of nagging her about screen time. Mittal emphasizes that children emulate actions, not words, and this applies to both parenting and workplace culture, where actions speak louder than words.

title: Gold price prediction: Where are gold rates headed in near-term?
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices experienced a slight dip, influenced by geopolitical developments surrounding Ukraine and anticipation of the Jackson Hole Symposium. Trump's meetings with Zelensky and European leaders offered some hope for de-escalation, while persistent sticking points in ceasefire negotiations limit further downside.

title: US reporter who mocked Zelenskyy earlier calls him 'fabulous' - How he responded
content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's attire choice during his White House visit with Donald Trump garnered significant attention. Learning from past criticism, Zelenskyy opted for a smart black jacket, impressing Trump and a reporter who had previously ridiculed his military-style clothing. This sartorial diplomacy aimed to foster a positive atmosphere for discussions on reaching a peace deal.

title: ‘We were open about it’: Duolingo CEO admits memo misfired; insists no layoffs planned
content: Duolingo CEO Luis von Ahn addressed user concerns after announcing the company's shift to an "AI-first" approach, clarifying it's a strategic enhancement, not a cost-cutting measure. Despite integrating AI to improve productivity and user experience, Duolingo maintains its no-layoff policy, focusing on empowering employees rather than replacing them.

title: ‘50 Palestinians for 1 Israeli’: Ex-intel chief justifies Gaza toll; audio leaked
content: Leaked audio reveals former Israeli intelligence chief Aharon Haliva saying that the deaths of tens of thousands in Gaza were necessary. He reportedly suggested a disproportionate response to the October 7th attacks, advocating for a 'Nakba' to make Palestinians feel the price. These remarks, condemned by Hamas, surfaced amidst growing international criticism of Israel's war strategy.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens above 24,900; Sensex up over 200 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Tuesday on the back of strong domestic news flow and global cues. While Nifty50 was above 24,900, BSE Sensex was near 81,500.

title: ‘Extremely difficult’: Tech CEO defends axing 80% staff; launches ‘AI Mondays’
content: IgniteTech CEO Eric Vaughan replaced nearly 80% of his workforce in 2023 after employees resisted the company's AI adoption mandate. Despite investing in AI education, widespread resistance, particularly from technical staff, led to mass personnel changes. This drastic restructuring yielded significant returns, with the company launching AI solutions and maintaining high profit margins.

title: Asia Cup squad: Abhishek Sharma a non-negotiable - numbers tell the story
content: The Ajit Agarkar-led selection committee will pick India’s squad for the 2025 Asia Cup, with Abhishek Sharma's selection a near certainty. His explosive IPL seasons and international success, including topping the ICC T20I batting rankings, make him indispensable. Sharma's formidable opening partnership with Sanju Samson and consistent performances solidify his place as India's T20I spearhead.

title: ‘Strong friends who help’: Zelenskyy praises US First Lady
content: Volodymyr Zelenskyy expressed gratitude to Melania Trump for her "peace letter" to Vladimir Putin, addressing the abduction of Ukrainian children, highlighting a painful issue of the conflict. Donald Trump and Ursula von der Leyen discussed the global problem of missing children, emphasizing reunification efforts. Melania Trump's letter urged Putin to protect Ukrainian children and restore their laughter.

title: 'A very good step': Trump to organise Putin-Zelenskyy talks
content: In a potential breakthrough, US President Donald Trump announced plans to mediate direct talks between Russian and Ukrainian Presidents to resolve the ongoing conflict. Trump stated on his Truth Social platform that he spoke with Russian President Vladimir Putin after hosting Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and other European leaders at the White House.

title: Red alert in Mumbai: 500mm downpour in just 84 hours; city flooded
content: Mumbai is under red alert as the IMD forecasts more heavy rainfall. Schools and colleges are closed, following over 500 mm of rain in 84 hours, causing widespread waterlogging and traffic disruptions. Two deaths were reported, and train services faced major delays. Mumbai University postponed exams, and nearby cities also closed educational institutions.

title: Top stocks to buy today: Recommendations for August 19 - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Mirae Asset Sharekhan's Somil Mehta recommends buying JSW Steel between Rs 1075 and Rs 1085, targeting Rs 1170, citing a breakout and positive momentum. Titan is also a buy, in the range of Rs 3550-3560, with a target of Rs 3850, following a bullish triangle breakout and support at its 200-day moving average.

title: Rohit Sharma beats rain, takes his favourite car for a spin in Mumbai - Watch
content: Rohit Sharma, unfazed by Mumbai's monsoon, was recently seen driving his Range Rover. The cricket star also added a Lamborghini Urus SE to his collection, sporting a personalised number plate reflecting his children's birthdays and jersey number. While enjoying his luxurious cars, Sharma is preparing for his potential final international series in Australia this October.

title: Army jawan on way back to Srinagar tied to pole, thrashed at Meerut toll plaza
content: In Meerut, an Army jawan was assaulted by toll plaza employees. The incident occurred after a dispute over passage. National Highways Authority of India fined the toll agency. Police arrested six individuals involved in the attack. Locals retaliated, damaging the toll plaza. The injured soldier received medical attention. Authorities are investigating the matter further.

title: Who Beer dated before? star’s past relationships resurface; dating rumors spotlight love life
content: Pop sensation Madison Beer's love life is again in the news. Her relationships have always been a topic of interest. She was earlier linked with Jack Gilinsky and Brooklyn Beckham. Her relationship with Zack Bia reportedly inspired her song 'Selfish'. Currently, she is in a relationship with Nick Austin. They have been together since 2020.

title: 'Coolie' box office collections: Rajinikanth’s actioner maintains strong pace; crosses Rs 206.65 cr
content: Rajinikanth's 'Coolie', directed by Lokesh Kanagaraj, has stormed the box office, grossing over Rs 200 crore in its first six days despite mixed reviews. The film opened strongly, collecting Rs 65 crore on day one, and features a star-studded cast including Nagarjuna Akkineni, Shruthi Haasan, and a cameo by Aamir Khan. 'Coolie' is being hailed as one of Rajinikanth's most electrifying performances in recent years.

title: Gujarat: Hidden phone filming women found in restaurant toilet; staffer arrested
content: In Surat's Piplod, a woman discovered a mobile phone hidden in the exhaust fan of K's Charcoal restaurant's toilet, which was recording her. Police arrested Surendra Rana, a sweeper at the restaurant, and seized two phones containing four indecent videos of customers.

title: Veteran actor Achyut Potdar passes away at 91
content: Veteran actor Achyut Potdar, known for his roles in Bollywood films and TV shows like '3 Idiots' and 'Wagle Ki Duniya', passed away on August 18, 2025, at the age of 91 in Thane's Jupiter Hospital. The cause of death is currently undisclosed.

title: Who will be INDIA bloc's VP pick? Announcement today; these names in fray
content: The INDIA bloc is set to announce its vice-presidential candidate, with discussions focusing on figures like scientist Mylswamy Annadurai and Dalit intellectual Tushar Gandhi. The decision to field a candidate aims to challenge the BJP's nominee and potentially revive memories of APJ Abdul Kalam.

title: FASTag annual pass launched: How many users signed up; which states lead
content: The FASTag Annual Pass, launched on Independence Day, has seen remarkable adoption, with over five lakh users subscribing within four days. This pass, designed for non-commercial vehicles, offers unlimited toll access for a year or 200 crossings for Rs 3,000. Tamil Nadu, Karnataka, and Haryana lead in purchases, reflecting the growing preference for electronic toll collection and seamless highway travel.

title: 'Pushed the rope backwards': Ex-cricketer on Suryakumar's World Cup catch
content: Ambati Rayudu has revealed that the boundary rope in the T20 World Cup final between India and South Africa was unintentionally moved back due to broadcast equipment. This adjustment, according to Rayudu, played a crucial role in Suryakumar Yadav's catch to dismiss David Miller. Despite the controversy, Rayudu maintains the catch was legitimate, attributing India's triumph to divine intervention.

title: Zelenskyy appears to accept Trump's terms to end war
content: Volodymyr Zelensky and other global leaders appear to have accepted Donald Trump's terms regarding the conflict with Russia. Discussions are anticipated to revolve around significant security assurances for Ukraine, contingent on the war's conclusion. Trump also indicated that Vladimir Putin is expected to release over 1,000 Ukrainian prisoners shortly after a trilateral meeting.

title: China & India should meet each other halfway: Beijing
content: External affairs minister S Jaishankar met with Chinese foreign minister Wang Yi in New Delhi, emphasising the need for candid and constructive dialogue to improve bilateral relations after a challenging period. Jaishankar stressed maintaining peace and de-escalation at the border as crucial for positive momentum. He raised concerns about trade restrictions and terrorism, advocating for global economic stability.

title: 'Manish Sisodia’s statement doesn’t reflect party ideology: AAP
content: Following opposition criticism of Manish Sisodia's controversial remark about using any means to win the 2027 elections, AAP Punjab chief Aman Arora distanced the party from the statement, asserting it doesn't reflect AAP's ideology. Arora emphasized that the party seeks votes through humility and highlighting their government's performance.

title: Shooting in West Virginia: 2 dead, three hurt; suspected gunman dead
content: A tragic incident occurred in Mount Carbon, West Virginia. Two individuals are dead after a shooting on Monday. Three others sustained injuries but are expected to recover. The suspected shooter was found dead inside his residence. Authorities believe he died from a self-inflicted gunshot.

title: Kuldeep Yadav + Varun Chakravarthy: India’s surprise Asia Cup weapon?
content: Kuldeep Yadav and Varun Chakravarthy eagerly await the Asia Cup 2025 squad announcement, hoping to showcase their spin prowess. Kuldeep, after a stint on the sidelines in England, aims to reignite his T20I form, while Varun looks to continue his impressive international return. Their coach believes their partnership could be a formidable weapon for India in the tournament.

title: Noah Lyles calls out Kishane Thompson: One-on-one race in Kingston; rivalry heats up
content: After Kishane Thompson's victory over Noah Lyles in Silesia, Lyles proposed a head-to-head rematch in Kingston, Jamaica, aiming to intensify their rivalry. Thompson responded with anticipation, promising "fireworks" in their upcoming races. Both sprinters are set to compete in Lausanne before heading to Tokyo, with their growing rivalry becoming a central narrative in track and field.

title: Eye on meeting’s outcome: Zelenskyy gets dressing down before talks; Trump vows 'lasting peace'
content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy met with US President Donald Trump and European leaders at the White House on Monday, opting for a black jacket instead of a formal suit. This contrasted with his pre-invasion attire of tailored suits, as since 2022, he has favored more casual, military-style clothing, including vyshyvanka.

title: 'Trump’s an outsider': Rodgers slams ex-president’s Covid response; NFL politics heat up again
content: Aaron Rodgers has reignited the debate surrounding the intersection of politics and sports by criticizing Donald Trump's handling of the Covid-19 pandemic, particularly his decision to keep Dr. Anthony Fauci in charge. Meanwhile, Trump has inserted himself into NFL storylines, endorsing Mason Rudolph amidst Pittsburgh's quarterback shuffle. The NFL remains a focal point in America's cultural and political landscape.

title: Mahomes: I didn’t believe Kelce at first about dating Taylor Swift
content: Patrick Mahomes initially doubted Travis Kelce's relationship with Taylor Swift, needing to witness it to believe it. He acknowledged the increased buzz and attention Swift brought to the stadium. Mahomes also praised Swift's dedication to her new album, revealed on Kelce's podcast, as both athletes focus on their comeback after a Super Bowl loss.

title: Ayesha Curry shares sweet clip of baby Cai ‘walking’ like dad Steph
content: Ayesha Curry shared heartwarming moments on Instagram, showcasing baby Cai following in Stephen Curry's basketball footsteps. The post featured Cai enthusiastically dunking a ball, capturing the attention of fans. Amidst Stephen's Curry Camp, Ayesha keeps fans updated on their family life, including celebrating their 14th wedding anniversary with a touching message for her husband.

title: Canadiens goalie Samuel Montembeault marries longtime love in Montreal
content: Montreal Canadiens goaltender Samuel Montembeault and Daryanne Ayotte celebrated their wedding in Montreal after seven years of relationship. The ceremony was attended by family, friends, and Canadiens teammates, including Brendan Gallagher and Nick Suzuki. With the wedding concluding a busy offseason, the team now shifts focus to the upcoming rookie camp and the 2025-26 NHL season.

title: Has Economic Offences Wing of T.N. police ever solved a case within reasonable time, asks Madras High Court
content: Justice G. Jayachandran poses the question during hearing of a bail petition filed by Devanathan Yadav of Mylapore Hindu Permanent Fund Nidhi Limited

title: SC gives bail to former West Bengal Minister in cash-for-jobs scam
content: The court ordered former Minister Partha Chatterjee to be released only after the trial court completed the examination of material witnesses in the case within two months

title: Opposition meet to pick V-P candidate remains inconclusive
content: Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge would be reaching out to top Opposition leaders on phone to arrive at the widest possible consensus before announcing their pick on Tuesday

title: Jadavpur varsity alumnus accused of orchestrating attack on WB Minister’s convoy gets bail
content: On August 15, the researcher was produced before a court in Kolkata, where the chief police prosecutor drew parallels between the attack on the American Centre in Kolkata in 2002 and the attack on the minister’s car, saying that the accused need not be present to plot an attack

title: Uttar Pradesh man dies in explosion in West Bengal’s Madhyamgram area, NIA visits spot
content: The victim was reportedly caught on CCTV walking with a bag, which exploded and maimed him on the spot

title: Government survey shows dip in unemployment rate
content: The Labour Bureau found that the unemployment rate in the country has come down by 0.4 percentile points to 5.2% in July from 5.6% in June

title: Rajnath gets YSRCP to back NDA’s V-P candidate
content: Rajnath reaches out to non-NDA parties such as the DMK, YSRCP and BJD; DMK unlikely to support NDA pick; Radhakrishnan expected to file his nominations for the election on August 20

title: Rain wreaks havoc in Maharashtra, brings Mumbai to a standstill
content: Four lakh hectares of cropland destroyed; 177 mm rain was reported within six hours in Mumbai; several flights were diverted, schools shut, buses rerouted, and local trains delayed

title: W.B. CM announces scheme for migrant workers facing harassment in other States
content: Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee says about 10,000 people have returned to the State in the past few months after being targeted in different States

title: Country will ask for affidavit from Election Commission of India: Rahul Gandhi
content: Rahul Gandhi, who urged the people of Bihar to prevent vote theft in the upcoming Assembly election and teach the poll body and the Prime Minister a “lesson”, says that once the INDIA bloc forms the government at the Centre, it will take “strict action” against CEC Gyanesh Kumar

title: Property documents, digital devices seized during ED searches on premises linked to Minister I. Periyasamy
content: The Directorate of Enforcement says the search team also found certain ‘paper companies’ being operated from the premises of Irulappa Mills, in which Mr. Periyasamy and his younger son P. Prabhu are directors. The accounts of these companies are being verified

title: POCSO Act is gender neutral, women can be made accused: Karnataka High Court
content: It refuses to quash a criminal case against a woman for allegedly compelling a 13-year-old boy to have sex with her

title: Minister promises thorough inquiry into maternal, infant deaths in Belagavi hospital
content: Sharan Prakash Patil was responding to a query by Congress member M. Nagaraj in the Legislative Council

title: Lokesh meets five Union Ministers, seeks speedy clearances for A.P. projects
content: He urges External Affairs Minister to help Andhra Pradesh in forging collaborations with Singapore and other countries; requests Nitin Gadkari’s nod for laying of a 56-km-long greenfield highway connecting Kuppam, Hosur and Bengaluru

title: Madras High Court refuses interim relief in TVK flag dispute case
content: Justice Senthilkumar Ramamoorthy rejects an application filed by a trust seeking an interim injunction against the party and its leader C. Joseph Vijay

title: Shakti scheme enters Golden Book of World Records
content: 500 crore women passengers travelled in non-premium government buses operated by the four State-run transport corporations-KSRTC, BMTC, NWKRTC and KKRTC between June 11, 2023 and July 25, 2025

title: IISc team’s new findings may have therapeutic implications in treating diabetes
content: The study shows how entry of glucose into the cell to kickstart insulin release falters in Type 2 diabetes and how restoring it could open new therapeutic avenues

title: Spillway discharge of flood at Sriramsagar begins with heavy inflows since Aug. 15
content: Release of water from the projects to FFC taken up to fill MMD, LMD, online reservoirs of Kaleshwaram project

title: Bihar SIR: Any person missing from draft rolls may file a claim with copy of Aadhaar, says Election Commission
content: In light of the INDIA bloc’s criticism of the ECI’s conduct, the Bihar CEO’s notice says ‘all such electors, whose names are not included in the draft roll, may obtain information about their entry and the reasons thereof by using their EPIC number in the published list’

title: In Bargarh rally, BJD reconnects with its base among farmers
content: The regional party has alleged the incumbent BJP-led State government created difficulties for farmers with complex rules to register for paddy procurement

title: Kerala govt. amends controversial order on HSS Principals
content: The order, which required higher secondary Principals to do the job of clerks, amended in the wake of complaints. Teachers point out that they have to work even after school hours to complete their responsibilities

title: Bars pegged at 840, timings extended till midnight under new policy in A.P.
content: Additional 10% licences for toddy tappers, allotment to be made through draw of lots for a three-year term beginning Sept. 1; no permission at religious places, barred along routes leading to Alipiri and Tirumala

title: Shubhanshu Shukla meets PM Modi; gifts tri-colour that travelled to space
content: Shubhanshu Shukla gifted the Prime Minister the mission patch of the Axiom-4 mission and the Indian tricolour that he had taken with him to the ISS

title: PM Modi chairs high-level meet on next-gen reforms
content: Union Ministers Rajnath Singh, Amit Shah, Nitin Gadkari, Nirmala Sitharaman, Shivraj Singh Chouhan, Piyush Goyal and Lalan Singh attended the meeting

title: Police deploy drones to monitor rain and flood situation in Eluru
content: Police say as the neighbouring Telangana is receiving heavy rains in the upstream villages, flood levels in Kolleru Lake have seen a rise leading to roads being submerged and many villages cut off

title: Hendrickson not budging in standoff with Bengals
content: Bengals defensive end Trey Hendrickson remains entrenched in his position on not playing in the upcoming season.

title: Commanders' Robinson sits out amid uncertainty
content: Washington Commanders veteran running back Brian Robinson Jr. did not play in his club's 31-17 preseason loss to the Cincinnati Bengals on Monday night in Landover, Maryland, possibly signaling the end of his tenure with the franchise after three seasons.

title: Titans QB Ward scuffles with DT Simmons in camp
content: Titans rookie QB Cam Ward got into a scuffle with defensive lineman Jeffrey Simmons as the two exchanged shoves.

title: D-backs star Marte apologizes, explains absence
content: Ketel Marte explained he was "frustrated" and "in a bad spot" after his home was burglarized during the All-Star break, leading him to miss games.

title: Vlad Jr. hurts hammy doing splits at 1B; MRI next
content: Toronto Blue Jays first baseman Vladimir Guerrero Jr. left Monday night's 5-2 loss to Pittsburgh because of hamstring tightness.

title: Padres' Bogaerts loses HR on fan interference call
content: San Diego's Xander Bogaerts had a home run overturned due to fan interference, and Padres manager Mike Shildt was ejected for coming out of the dugout to talk to the umpires in the second inning of Monday night's 4-3 loss to the San Francisco Giants.

title: Texas Tech's Joyner, USC transfer, out for season
content: Texas Tech running back Quinten Joyner, a projected starter who transferred from USC, will sit out the 2025 season after he sustained a non-contact knee injury in Saturday's scrimmage.

title: UFC HOFer Edgar unretiring for Bare Knuckle fight
content: UFC Hall of Famer Frankie Edgar is poised to come out of retirement for a bare-knuckle boxing contest.

title: 🏈 Fantasy football: Our brand new mock draft
content: Peak draft season is almost here. Our crew provides a good practice run through a 12-teamer to help you prepare for the real thing.

title: 'You felt the momentum change': Michael Vick's early impact at Norfolk State
content: Vick is coaching just 30 miles from where he grew up, and in the state where he electrified college football as a player.

title: Irish Farmageddon, a new option team and ... UTEP?! Your guide to CFB fun in 2025
content: The biggest games, wildest races, must-see players and small-school mayhem. Bill Connelly is here for it all.

title: A quest to understand the Carlos Alcaraz/Emma Raducanu ship
content: Carlos Alcaraz and Emma Raducanu say they're just friends. But a growing group of their fans is rooting for far more than just a US Open mixed doubles title. Welcome to the world of tennis shippers.

title: Barnwell picks five NFL teams set to improve: Who could go from worst to first?
content: Which teams will win more this season? We made five picks based on offseason additions, fumble luck and more.

title: What Browns naming Joe Flacco QB1 means for Shedeur Sanders, Dillon Gabriel
content: The questions surrounding the Browns' Week 1 starter are answered, but the clock to begin finding the long-term solution continues to run.

title: Answering the biggest questions facing Keegan Bradley with six U.S. Ryder Cup spots left
content: Will Bradley choose himself to play at ? Who are locks to make the team? We answer some of the biggest questions with six captain's picks left to fill out the team.

title: Venus Williams is back at the US Open -- eyeing one title not on her long list
content: Two-time former US Open champion Venus Williams will play again this week. And she still has one major career goal.

title: Barcelona's hot start, Bayern win Supercup, more from the weekend
content: We're back for the 2025-26 and Gab Marcotti has a lot to unpack from opening weekend! From Arsenal's win over Man United to Barcelona's hot start, let's recap the weekend.

title: The stat that could swing every NBA team's 2025-26 season
content: What numbers are teams focused on with just over a month until camp? Zach Kram runs down the big stat for all 30 franchises.

title: 'We know how to weather storms': How the Aces saved their WNBA season
content: Las Vegas, .500 at the All-Star break, has won seven straight and is vying to host early WNBA playoff games.

title: Solak: Everything I learned at 10 different NFL training camp stops
content: After visits with 10 NFL teams in eight states, Ben Solak compiled the best things he heard -- and saw -- throughout the trip.

title: The VAR Review: Explaining Eze's disallowed goal, and why Senesi escaped a red card
content: Looking at Eberechi Eze's disallowed free kick for Crystal Palace at Chelsea, and Marcos Senesi's possible red card against Liverpool.

title: Messi's return helps Miami's surge
content: Lionel Messi's return is a huge boost for Inter Miami as they look to take the top spot in the latest ESPN Power Rankings.

title: Inside the hidden costs of football: '88 Saints speak out
content: Nearly 40 years after their time in the NFL, the players from the 1988 New Orleans Saints grapple with the physical toll of football while honoring a bond forged through the toughest game.

title: Texans and Eagles trading previously dealt picks back to each other? Who won the Bryant-Metchie trade?
content: Who won the recent Texans-Eagles trade? What about the Jalen Ramsey-Minkah Fitzpatrick swap? We sized up the offseason's trades.

title: How clubs are using loyalty against unhappy or unwanted stars
content: Loyalty is a virtue, but in football business comes first. Isak is now walking the rocky path previously taken by stars like Alexander-Arnold and Kane.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United braced for Chelsea's opening Garnacho bid
content: Manchester United will hold firm on their valuation of Chelsea target Alejandro Garnacho. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Trump Runs Into Difficulty Of Putin Diplomacy, Ending A Long War
content: President Donald Trump walked into a summit with Russian President Vladimir Putin pressing for a ceasefire deal and threatening "severe consequences" and tough new sanctions if the Kremlin leader failed to agree to halt the fighting in Ukraine.

title: "Allow Parliament To Felicitate" Shubhanshu Shukla: Kiren Rijiju To Opposition
content: Union Kiren Rijiju appealed to Opposition parties to allow Parliament to felicitate Axiom-4 Mission Pilot and IAF Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla, along with Indian scientists, for the country's recent success in space exploration.

title: Mumbai Continues To Witness Heavy Rain, Schools Shut, Local Trains Delayed
content: Mumbai witnessed severe inundation in low-lying areas, delayed local train services and traffic snarls at various places on Tuesday morning as there was no respite from heavy rains in the metropolis and neighbouring areas.

title: OpenAI Launches New 'ChatGPT Go' Plan In India, Check Prices, Features
content: OpenAI has announced ChatGPT Go, its new subscription plan priced at Rs 399 a month that packs in increased message limits, image generation and file uploads for users in India.

title: "Unilateral Bullying Rampant": What China Told India Amid Trump Tariff War
content: Five years after their armies fought a pitched battle in Galwan, India and China are working to mend ways as the Donald Trump administration in the US steps up the tariff war against New Delhi

title: 2 Sikh Men Assaulted By Teenagers In Racist Attack In UK, Video Emerges
content: In a hate crime in the UK, two Sikh men were assaulted by three teenagers last Friday (August 15), causing a massive uproar. The racist attack occurred outside a railway station in Wolverhampton.

title: "Zero Tolerance": Mahindra Group As Staff Sends Rape, Death Threats To BJD MP
content: The BJD MP had posted screenshots of the rape and death threats written by the Mahindra Group employee, identified as Satyabrata Nayak.

title: Trump-Zelensky Meeting Live: Trump Says He Is Setting Up Direct Russia-Ukraine Talks
content: Trump-Zelensky Meeting Live Updates: Russian and Ukrainian presidents Vladimir Putin and Volodymyr Zelensky looked set for a peace summit following fast-moving talks hosted by US President Donald Trump.

title: Italy's PM Meloni Greets US Aide With 'Namaste'
content: Amid the hubbub of Trump's multilateral meeting with European Union leaders and Zelenskyy, Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni's arrival grabbed eyeballs as she greeted the Chief of Protocol of the US, Monica Crowley, with 'namaste'.

title: Video: Woman Cop Asks Auto To Stop, Drunk Driver Drags Her For 120 Metres
content: A reckless incident has emerged from Maharashtra wherein a woman traffic cop was dragged for over 100 metres by an auto driven by a drunk man.

title: Shubhanshu Shukla Shows Pics Of Earth From Space During Meet With PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi met Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla this evening, a day after the astronaut returned to India after his historic visit to the International Space Station (ISS).

title: Donald Trump Revokes Over 6,000 Student Visas For Overstays, Crimes
content: The administration of President Donald Trump has revoked more than 6,000 student visas for overstays and breaking the law, including a small minority for "support for terrorism," a State Department official said on Monday.

title: Video: 5 Injured After High-Rise Ride Crashes At Temple Fair In Gujarat
content: Five persons, two of them children, were severely injured after a high-rise spinning ride crashed at a crowded temple fair in Gujarat's Navsari district, police said on Monday.

title: Security Guarantees For Ukraine To Be Worked Out Within 10 Days, Says Zelensky
content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said on Tuesday after his meeting with US President Donald Trump and European leaders that security guarantees for Kyiv will likely be worked out within 10 days.

title: France Calls For Sanctions Against Russia If Diplomacy Fails
content: French President Emmanuel Macron called Monday for stepping up sanctions against Russia if its leader Vladimir Putin does not move forward on peace with Ukraine.

title: Putin, Zelensky Closer To Peace Talks Than Ever After Trump Talks
content: Russian and Ukrainian presidents Vladimir Putin and Volodymyr Zelensky looked set for a peace summit after fast-moving talks Monday between Donald Trump and European leaders that focused on the key issue of long-term security guarantees for Kyiv.

title: German Chancellor Says Putin, Zelensky To Meet Within Next 2 Weeks
content: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz credited U.S. President Donald Trump with persuading Russia's President to agree to a meeting with his Ukrainian counterpart.

title: Odisha Auto Driver Sexually Assaults Minor Girl, Threatens To Set Her On Fire
content: An autorickshaw driver was arrested for sexually assaulting a minor girl and allegedly threatening to set her on fire if she resisted in Odisha's Cuttack.

title: Toll Plaza Fined Rs 20 Lakh After Staff Ties Up, Thrashes Soldier With Stick
content: State-owned NHAI has imposed a Rs 20 lakh fine on the toll collection agency of Bhuni toll plaza in Meerut where an Army personnel was beaten up by toll staff, an official statement said on Monday.

title: "He Wants To Make Deal With...": Trump's Hot Mic Moment On Putin Goes Viral
content: Vladimir Putin and Volodymyr Zelensky looked set for a peace summit after fast-moving talks on Monday between US commander-in-chief Donald Trump and European leaders, focusing on the key issue of long-term security guarantees for Kyiv.
